title: Tenute di Fraternita 2013 Ser Mariotto  (Chianti)
description: Made from 85% Sangiovese and 15% Cabernet Sauvignon, this opens with toasted oak, mocha and dark-skinned berry aromas. The dense palate offers clove, blackberry jam and roasted coffee notes alongside close-grained tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: The Infinite Monkey Theorem 2014 Bubble Universe Sparkling (Colorado)
description: Intensely floral aromas of summer rose gardens and lavender fields leap from the glass, with hints of freshly peeled orange peeking through. The palate is equally playful in flavors of lemon juice and orange-blossom honey, kept light by tangy acidity and jubilant bubbles. White peach joins lemon juice on the finish, with just a touch of nuttiness bringing it to a close.

title: Tiki Sound 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is a pretty, delicate wine with notes of honey, blossoms, peaches and lychees and tomato leaf. There's a lovely chalky texture, with mouthwatering acidity and a ripe fruit character adding to the wine's charm.

title: Weixelbaum 2017 Stephanus Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Aromatic green and fresh yellow pear combine to very appetizing effect on the nose. The palate is less overt in fruit but brings bright zesty citrus to the fore. This is refreshing, light, slender and dry.

title: Wild Hogge 2012 Moongate Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 75% Primitivo, 13% Syrah and 12% Cabernet Franc is starting to show its age, offering rustic dried red-cherry, dust and leather flavors. There are hints of clove and cinnamon decorating the candied red fruit of the palate, but it's time to drink up on this bottling.

title: Allram 2017 Strass Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: The nose has both a tangy and a creamy aspect and both are equally enticing. On the light easy palate, gentle pear fruit is supported by bright lemony freshness. The finish is dry and tangy.

title: Argillae 2016 Grechetto (Umbria)
description: Honeysuckle and yellow stone fruit aromas lead the nose of this wine. On the fresh, medium-bodied palate, white almond accents back up ripe peach and apple flavors while a salty mineral note marks the close.

title: Auclair 2015 Left Blend Artz Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)
description: Three-quarters Cabernet Sauvignon, with the balance Cabernet Franc (19%) and Merlot, aromas of plum, dried cherry, smoke, golden raisin and dried herb lead to slightly sweet-seeming fruit flavors backed by highly structured acid and tannins. There are lots of good things going on but the fruit seems ever so slightly desiccated.

title: Black Elephant 2017 Two Dogs, A Peacock & A Horse Sauvignon Blanc (Franschhoek)
description: This fresh and well-balanced white opens with notes of sweet pea, fresh grass, orange blossom and lemon leaf. It's a refined and delicate pour, with refreshing acidity and clean flavors of white melon rind and citrus rind that lend a pleasant pithiness to the fresh finish. Drink now–2019.
designation: Two Dogs, A Peacock & A Horse

title: Boccafosca 2016 Stellaria  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
description: This opens with subtle citrus and white spring flower aromas while the palate offers white peach and apricot notes. It's bright and crisp on the close.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2015 Viña Albina Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry aromas are leathery and oaky, with a hint of prune. A chunky, plump palate is fairly resiny in feel. Flavors of vanilla along with old-style oak and tobacco interplay with berry-fruit notes that push up against overripe. On the finish, this holds onto its overt oak-influenced character.

title: Boxwood 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Middleburg)
description: This wine offers lemon, grapefruit, chamomile and a soft, green mossiness on the nose. Pea shoots, citrus and crushed minerals dance on the tongue with vibrant acidity. It finishes zippy and crisp, and would be perfect with oysters.

title: Casalfarneto 2015 Grancasale  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
description: This opens with tropical fruit and white spring flower aormas. The creamy, forward palate delivers pineapple, ripe Bartlett pear and acacia honey flavors. Drink through 2019.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

title: Château Coussin 2017 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)
description: This full-bodied wine comes from vines grown on the alluvial fan at the base of the Sainte Victoire mountain. That gives richness to balance the acidity and lightly herbal character of the wine. It could age a few months more and will be best from late 2018.

title: Château d'Esclans 2017 Whispering Angel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This almost white-colored wine is the latest edition of a best-seller. It is full of bold red fruits, crisp with acidity and ripe in character. Balanced and delicious, it's ready to drink.

title: Château Font du Broc 2017 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Reflecting the warm vintage, this ripe wine is rich with red-berry fruits, gentle acidity and a tangy, peppery texture. It has spice as well as attractive fruits and delicious final acidity. Drink now.

title: Château Réal d'Or 2017 Monaco La Riviera Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Drawing on the French Riviera's two attractions, the Monte Carlo casino and the beaches, this wine aims to win out both on its fruitiness and its name. Both work, because the wine with its red fruits will be just right either in the sun or at the gambling tables. Drink now.

title: Delas Frères 2016 Saint-Esprit Red (Côtes du Rhône)
description: This is a bit muted on the nose, suggesting slightly baked rather than fresh black fruit. It's full bodied and richly concentrated, balancing forward black cherry and berry notes with fresh acidity and finely edged, persistent tannins. Hints of dried herbs lend elegance to the moderately long finish.

title: Domaine de la Croix 2017 Eloge Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This wine is tight and crisp, intense with acidity and red-currant flavors. It has a strong mineral edge as well as the perfumed fruitiness. It's a wine for food; drink from late 2018 when the acidity has calmed down.

title: Domaine Houchart 2017 White (Côtes de Provence)
description: Clairette and Rolle, both classic local white grapes, have produced a wine with crispness, herbal flavors and delicate acidity. The wine is full of peach and citrus flavors along with great freshness. Drink from late 2018.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2015 Dutton Ranch Freestone Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a coastal site, this wine exudes notes of forest pine, rose petal and dried herbs. The thickly textured core of ripe fruit offers weight and youthful complexity.

title: 1752 Signature Wines 2017 Marion Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: The pale color is reflected in the light texture of this accessible wine. Its warm red fruits, cut with acidity, are a classic blend of Grenache, Cinsault and Syrah, allowing room for plenty of fruitiness as well as a crisp tangy texture. Drink now.

title: Airfield Estates 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)
description: Aromas of tire rubber, green pepper, blackberry and sweet barrel spice are followed by ripe fruit flavors that finish a bitter touch. The tannins dry out the finish.

title: Alma de Cattleya 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: Soft rounded tones of strawberry, melon and lemon are straightforward and likable on the nose of this pink Pinot Noir. The palate combines light raspberry and red-apple skins with the hint of lime juice.

title: Bernard Magrez 2017 Douce Vie Tentation Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: One of three Provence wines produced by major Bordeaux chateau owner Bernard Magrez, this wine is ripe and full, generous both with its red fruits and acidity. It is stylish with a crisp edge and a clean, fruity aftertaste. Drink this attractive wine now.

title: Black Stallion 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Tropical and nutty in tone, this full-bodied concentrated wine offers robust foundations of oak with creamy fulfilling layers of pineapple and papaya. There's a hint of reduction on the nose that invites.

title: Board Track Racer 2016 The Vincent Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas bring fresh notes of lemon zest and yellow apple. The palate is full bodied and lightly creamy in feel, with roasted corn notes on the finish.

title: Bodegas Aquitania 2016 Bernon Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Flowery white-fruit aromas are mellow. A round melony palate is a touch soft but holding on. Melon and peach flavors are basic but perfectly good, while this is just vital enough on the finish. Drink up!

title: Brotte 2017 Esprit Barville White (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Briskly concentrated Asian pear and grapefruit flavors are accented by crisp acidity and a clean, mineral tone in this full-bodied but fresh white. It's an easy-drinking dry wine to enjoy now–2020.

title: Brunori 2016 Le Gemme  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
description: This opens with delicate hawthorn and citrus aromas. The bright palate offers Granny Smith apple and Concorde pear flavors, crisp acidity and an almondy finish.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico
